sentences.en: ‘How did you get here?’ ‘We walked.’
sentences.cn: “你们是怎么来这里的？”“我们是步行来的。”

sentences.en: "Can you walk all right?" the nurse asked him.
sentences.cn: “你走路有困难吗？”护士问他。

sentences.en: Do not wait for good things to happen to you. You need to walk towards happiness.
sentences.cn: 不要等待好事降临，你要向幸福进发。

sentences.en: Doctors said he’d never walk again.
sentences.cn: 医生说他再也不能行走了。

sentences.en: Footballers in whopping great studded boots walk over the pitch.
sentences.cn: 脚蹬帅气钉靴的足球运动员走进了球场。

sentences.en: He closed his door and started the quarter-mile walk down the hill.
sentences.cn: 他关上门,踏上了1/4英里长的下山路.

sentences.en: He loved walking in the hills.
sentences.cn: 他喜欢在山里散步。

sentences.en: He turned with a little nod and I watched him walk away.
sentences.cn: 他边点了点头边转过身，我看着他走了。

sentences.en: He was in no hurry to walk down the aisle.
sentences.cn: 他并不急于结婚。

sentences.en: I walk my dog each evening around my local streets.
sentences.cn: 我每晚在家附近的街道上遛狗。

sentences.en: I walked a few steps toward the fence.
sentences.cn: 我向栅栏走了几步。

sentences.en: I walked all the way to San Rafael.
sentences.cn: 我一路走到圣拉斐尔。

sentences.en: I went for a walk.
sentences.cn: 我去散步了。

sentences.en: It’s a long walk. Maybe we should get the bus.
sentences.cn: 走着去很远，或许我们应该乘公共汽车。

sentences.en: Now then, you say you walk on the fields out the back?
sentences.cn: 那么，你说你在后面的田地里散步？

sentences.en: One day she will walk out, just as her own mother did.
sentences.cn: 总有一天她会离家出走，就像她母亲那样。

sentences.en: Rosanna and Forbes walked in silence.
sentences.cn: 罗莎娜与福布斯默默地走着。

sentences.en: She noticed her own proud walk had become a shuffle.
sentences.cn: 她意识到自己趾高气扬的步伐已变成了拖着脚走路了。

sentences.en: She went for a brisk walk to work off her frustration.
sentences.cn: 她快步走了一会儿，以排解心中的沮丧。

sentences.en: The boys were as good as gold on our walk.
sentences.cn: 我们散步的时候，这帮小男孩表现得很乖。

sentences.en: The church is a short walk from Piazza Dante.
sentences.cn: 教堂离但丁广场只有几步之遥。

sentences.en: the courses attracted people from all walks of life.
sentences.cn: 这些课程吸引了各行各业的人。

sentences.en: The dancers began to walk away from the floor.
sentences.cn: 跳舞的人们开始离开舞池。

sentences.en: We walked into the foyer.
sentences.cn: 我们走进前厅。

sentences.en: When I left school, I could walk into any job.
sentences.cn: 我毕业后可以不费吹灰之力地找到任何工作。

sentences.en: you don't want to let the cops walk all over you.
sentences.cn: 你不想让警察随意欺侮吧。

words.tran_cn: 步行者；散步者；参加竞走者

phrases.tran_cn: 轻易脱身，随便离开岗位
离开；轻易地胜过；从...旁边走开
先学走后学跑（先掌握基本技能，然后再试图做更难的事情）
通过散步消除；在步行速度和距离上胜过
v. 走进；不慎陷入；痛斥
走出；罢工；退席；把（某人）领出
走过；轻松地初排；草率地处理
走在一起，结伴同行；一起散步

trans.tran_cn: 行走，步行，徒步旅行，散步，步行的路径/距离，步态，步行速度，小路，人行道
trans.tran_en: a journey that you make by walking, especially for exercise or enjoyment
to move forward by putting one foot in front of the other

trans.tran_cn: 走，步行，徒步旅行，散步，陪同，护送，遛（狗），不翼而飞
trans.tran_en: When you walk, you move forward by putting one foot in front of the other in a regular way
